definition: Ulaanbaatar or Ulan Bator, capital of Mongolia
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
crow/black
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: A truth-sharing video seminar held in Ulaanbaatar.
sentences.chinese: 在乌兰巴托举办电视弘法讲座。

sentences.english: "We may not be able to raise our animals in UB, " he went on.
sentences.chinese: 在乌兰巴托，我们也许不能再养牲口了。

sentences.english: The prevalence of non-prescribed antibiotic use for young children was high in Ulaanbaatar.
sentences.chinese: 乌兰巴托幼儿使用非处方抗生素十分普遍。

sentences.english: Alcoholism is rampant among UB's poor and unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 酗酒问题在乌兰巴托的穷困和失业人口中猖獗泛滥。

sentences.english: The government square of Mongolia's capital Ulaanbaatar.
sentences.chinese: 外蒙首都乌兰巴托的国家广场。

sentences.english: The journey from Irkutsk to Ulan Bator got off to an alarming start.
sentences.chinese: 从伊尔库茨克到乌兰巴托的旅程有个吓人的开端。

sentences.english: An aerial view of Ulan Bator's Sukhbaatar Square shows the Mongolian Parliament.
sentences.chinese: 乌兰巴托苏赫巴托广场的鸟瞰图，展示了蒙古国会。

definition: Mongolia
Manzhouli county level city, Mongolian Manzhuur xot, in Hulunbuir 呼倫貝爾|呼伦贝尔[Hu1 lun2 bei4 er3], Inner Mongolia
Almaty, previous capital of Kazakhstan

Irkutsk
Novosibirsk (city in Russia)
Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan
Ergun county level city, Mongolian Ergüne xot, in Hulunbuir 呼倫貝爾|呼伦贝尔[Hu1 lun2 bei4 er3], Inner Mongolia
Moscow, capital of Russia
Kyrgyz/Kyrgyzstan
Outer Mongolia
Yekaterinburg (Russian city, also known as Ekaterinburg or Sverdlovsk)
Khabarovsk, far eastern Russian city and province on the border with Heilongjiang province of China
pinyin: Ha1 ba1 luo2 fu1 si1 ke4

definition: Choibalsan, city in Mongolia, capital of the eastern aimag (province) of Dornod/Khorloogiin Choibalsan (1895-1952), Communist leader of the Mongolian People's Republic (mid-1930s-1952)
People's Republic of Mongolia (from 1924)
pinyin: Meng3 gu3 Ren2 min2 Gong4 he2 guo2

definition: Vladivostok/Ming and Qing name for Vladivostok 符拉迪沃斯托克 and the province around it
